learning_outcomes.description: Understand the theoretical background of, application of, and mathematical formulation for the following statistical procedures:1. z-test2. Repeated measures and independent groups t-tests3. Power4. ANOVA5. Correlation6. Multiple regression7. Non-parametric versions of each of the above
Write the 'Results' component of a research report.

assessments.due_date:
In-semester Saturday

6/09/2025 - 20/09/2025

The mid-semester exam date will be set by UQ and will be held on a Saturday.
assessments.task_description:
• The mid-semester exam will be a 90 minute invigilated, open-book exam run by UQ.
  • The exam will assess theory and application of statistical concepts covered in the lectures (Weeks 1-4) and tutorials (Weeks 2-4). Students will need to able to perform calculations covered in lectures and the tutorials to answer some questions.
  • The exam is open book and you can bring in any written materials that you would like (e.g., lecture and tutorial slides; the student workbook, etc).
  • You will need a calculator for this exam. It must be a UQ approved calculator.
  • The exam will consist of multiple-choice questions only. Some multiple-choice questions will be stand-alone. Other multiple-choice questions will be components of one broader question.
  • The date for the mid-semester exam is set centrally by UQ. The exam will take place on a Saturday.
  • Tutors will also hold consultations for exam feedback after all students have completed the exam (times announced on Learn.UQ).
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

assessments.task_description:
• This assignment will be discussed in more detail during semester.
  • Assignments are to be submitted electronically via Turnitin.
  • Note: See information regarding extensions and late penalties within the School of Psychology
  • Late assignments will not be accepted after marks have been released (approximately three weeks after assignments are submitted).
assessments.submission_guidelines: Assignments are to be submitted online via Learn.UQ/Turnitin.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
• The final exam will be an in-person, closed book exam held during the examination period and administered by the UQ Central Examinations unit.
  • The exam will assess theory and application of statistical concepts covered in lectures and tutorials (Weeks 5 - 13). Students will need to able to perform calculations covered in lectures and the tutorials to answer some questions. Students will also be required to interpret statistical results.
  • The exam will consist of multiple-choice questions only. Some multiple-choice questions will be stand-alone. Other multiple-choice questions will be components of one broader question.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

learning_activities.topic:
Lecture 1

Course introduction and review of PSYC1040 material: normal distributions, z-scores, and sampling distributions of the mean.


Learning outcomes: L01, L02
learning_activities.topic_description: Lecture 1 Course introduction and review of PSYC1040 material: normal distributions, z-scores, and sampling distributions of the mean.

learning_activities.topic:
Lecture 2

Further review: "hypothesis-testing" when the population variance is known (Z test) and unknown (single sample t-test).


Learning outcomes: L01, L02
learning_activities.topic_description: Lecture 2 Further review: "hypothesis-testing" when the population variance is known (Z test) and unknown (single sample t-test).

learning_activities.topic:
Tutorial 1

Basic concepts & Single-Sample Tests


Learning outcomes: L01, L02
learning_activities.topic_description: Tutorial 1 Basic concepts & Single-Sample Tests

learning_activities.topic:
Lecture 3

Two-sample t-tests, using the same people twice (repeated measures) or two different groups (independent groups), and what statistical assumptions their validity depends on.


Learning outcomes: L01, L02
learning_activities.topic_description: Lecture 3 Two-sample t-tests, using the same people twice (repeated measures) or two different groups (independent groups), and what statistical assumptions their validity depends on.

learning_activities.topic:
Tutorial 2

Two-Sample t-tests


Learning outcomes: L01, L02

Statistical power and effect size, plus information about the mid-semester exam (quiz).


Learning outcomes: L01

learning_activities.topic:
Tutorial 3

Statistical Power


Learning outcomes: L01, L02

learning_activities.topic:
Lecture 5. ANOVA I

One-way independent-groups ANOVA, including partitioning of variance, the underlying structural model, and calculations for the test.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02
learning_activities.topic_description: Lecture 5. ANOVA I One-way independent-groups ANOVA, including partitioning of variance, the underlying structural model, and calculations for the test.

Follow-up tests for Independent-groups ANOVA using Bonferroni corrected t-tests, planned comparisons, and post-hoc tests.

learning_activities.topic:
Lecture 8. ANOVA IV and Non-parametric tests I

Factorial designs (a kind of design with more than one independent variable) and interactions, plus introduction to analyses that require fewer statistical assumptions than t-tests or ANOVA.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02

learning_activities.topic_description: Lecture 8. ANOVA IV and Non-parametric tests I Factorial designs (a kind of design with more than one independent variable) and interactions, plus introduction to analyses that require fewer statistical assumptions than t-tests or ANOVA.

learning_activities.topic:
Lecture 10. Correlation I

Due to the public holiday this lecture will be made available via a recording posted on BB. You are encouraged to listen to the lecture before attending your tutorials. Introduction, calculating r and variance accounted for (r-square), plus non-parametric versions of r.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02
learning_activities.topic_description: Lecture 10. Correlation I Due to the public holiday this lecture will be made available via a recording posted on BB. You are encouraged to listen to the lecture before attending your tutorials.  Introduction, calculating r and variance accounted for (r-square), plus non-parametric versions of r.

learning_activities.topic:
Lecture 11. Correlation II & Regression I

Extends the concept of correlation (relationship between two variables) to regression (using correlation and a known state of one variable to predict the state of another variable).

Learning outcomes: L01, L02
learning_activities.topic_description: Lecture 11. Correlation II & Regression I Extends the concept of correlation (relationship between two variables) to regression (using correlation and a known state of one variable to predict the state of another variable).
